availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Ramer (Hickman County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Tennessee native. Married to Nancy Stone Ramer. Father of John H. Ramer, A. T. Ramer, Martha S. Ramer, Jemima Ann Ramer, Samuel S. Ramer, James Sidney Ramer, Thaddeus Ramer, Louis Napoleon Ramer, and George Gray Ramer. Blacksmith in Hickman County in 1850. Employed Thomas Miller as a blacksmith in Hickman County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Hickman County in 1850. Master blacksmith in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, p. 8B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, p. 6.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Moscow, p. 475A.
